Reviews.Title: “Incroyable !!”
Reviews.Author: PabsKuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 12 trough 18th 2012 Let's just say incroyable !! The Best Hotel in Paris !! 1st : The location, one of the Most beautiful Streets in Paris 2nd: The staff , from the Porters the way they welcome us to the Hotel , and their friendliness and help trough the stay . The Concierge Mr. Jerome Poret and His Satff , always ready to help and suggest . The Hostess and Servers at The Galerie De Goblins and The Terrace , very friendly and very personable. The Bar staff , Great and Fun people . 3rd: The Room , We stayed in Suite Room 102-103 , what can We say , just beautiful ,very spacious , and beautifully decorated , right on Ave. Montaigne . 4th: The Food , Breakfast at Alain Ducasse restaurant , what else can I say, Galerie De Goblins great tea and Dinner, The terrace also great snacks and sanwiches, and Room Service that was perfect. Overall a beautiful and Great Hotel with an incredible Staff , great location , beautiful building and interiors and as The Hotel Plaza Athenee says : it was " A sparkling and Magical experience " Merci beaucoup Definetly going back .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denis S
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Paris. The decoration of the hotel is great making you feel like home. We enjoyed having our coffee at the lobby bar near the entrance and the restaurants are really nice. The rooms have all facilities someone would ask for. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Parisian luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We had a magical stay at the Plaza Athenee this past February. Everything about the hotel was exquisite so here are the main highlights: 1. Decor: As befits one of the top hotels in Paris, the Plaza Athenee was sumptuously decorated throughout with ornate French antiques, tapestries, crystal chandliers and breathtaking flower arrangements. The best way to describe the hotel's style is "quiet luxury". 2. Room: We were given Room 112 which was a junior suite with a king sized bed overlooking Avenue Montaigne. It was quite large and elegantly decorated in various shades of cream and pale gold with a dashes of hot pink and eggplant here and there. A platter of fresh fruit awaited us along with a handwritten note. They also offered to unpack our luggage. 3. Fitness Facility: Down in the Dior Spa area, there was a small but well appointed gym with several treadmills and elliptical machines from which one could watch tv or browse the internet. There was also a free weight area. In addition to complimentary fruit and water in the gym, there were sauna and steam rooms. 4. Service: The staff at the Plaza Athenee were exceptionally gracious and professional. As you can imagine, they all spoke excellent English and expertly attended to our requests for dinner reservations and help with taxis. 5. Food: Our breakfast of egg white omelets, whole wheat toast and coffee was delicious and promptly brought to our room within a very reasonable time of 20 minutes after placing our order. 6. Toiletries: These were custom made for the Plaza Athenee, plentifuland had a delicate white tea fragrance. We had an unforgettable experience and I cannot recommend the Plaza Athenee highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “always high class”
Reviews.Author: SYZ2012
Reviews.Content: great hotel positioned on Avenue Montaigne of the the most expensive avenue in Paris, crowded with posh people and designer stores. It is a very trendy place where you can see celebrities (mainly from America). The bar is a must go place after midnight. Service is amazing, prices are on the high side.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aytou
Reviews.Content: Plaza Athenee, Paris, is a great hotel of high standards. The food is delicious, the rooms spacious, the service excellent, the staff very nice.... It is the hotel to visit, at least once. BUT, it is extremely very expensive!!! What to expect when royal families stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarag7229
Reviews.Content: Expensive breakfast Lighting in the room a bit high tech Overall very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “So Very Posh”
Reviews.Author: 1LATraveler1
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay in this hotel and it did not disappoint, but it was different than I thought it would be. We stayed there 4 nights on the Paris leg of our trip. We stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious, with great amenities and a comfortable bed. The room had a king size bed, a seating area and a work station, with 1.5 bathrooms. Lots of closet space for people that like to unpack. The main bathroom had a separate shower and bath and was very spacious. There was also a nice powder room. We had an interior courtyard view, which was fine and probably made the room quiet, but I may ask for a city view next time. The hotel is completely over the top. From the moment you walk in, they treat you like royalty--with lots of people greeting you and asking you if all is well-- and it seems that they make it a point to learn your name. We had 2 people helping us to our room even though there were only 2 of us with one bag each. There was wine and a coffee cake waiting for us in the room. The conceirge and the reception staff made it a point to greet us every time we walked into the hotel was nice, but could be overwhelming at times. Continental breakfast at Alaine Ducasse was included with our rate. The breakfast was good, but if you go in jeans, you will feel underdressed. In fact, you will generally feel underdressed in jeans in the hotel--from the bar to the lobby lounge to breakfast at Alaine Ducasse. The hotel caters to a high-end clientele, so the atmosphere is very dressed up and all of their restaurant recommendations are also very high end. The recommendations were generally fine with us, but sometimes you just want a quaint cafe with good, easy food. Bottom line, I loved the hotel and would stay there again, but it is not an easy, laid back atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Roscoe2002
Reviews.Content: Staying for four days on business and found the staff all incredibly nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “European Tour, Plaza Athenee Paris”
Reviews.Author: CyrusE
Reviews.Content: Being the second stop on mine and my family's twelve day european trip. I don't know whether it was because of the incredibly high standard that our first stop at the Blakes Hotel in London had set, our because all the hype that had been created before my arrival at this hotel that I was incredibly disappointed. The hotel is certainly a classic, but will not fit people with an ultra modern taste. The lunch menu on the terrace was incredibly overpriced and we paid the equivalent of 2 days of dining in London for a Family lunch for four.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful, planning your trip”
Reviews.Author: Yuliya M
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay for 4 nights in Paris and celebrate the birthday of child. It took us a long time to choose from variety of hotels, we tried to find the best solution and supposed to have this in Plaza Athenee. We are 5 people (4 adult and 1 child), we asked 2 connecting rooms, when we made a reservation. When we arrived, everything was really wonderful! The atmosphere, friendly personal met us, but when we entered the room, we understood we have only one shower for this to rooms. In one room bath only and in another bath and shower. Actually it is not a big problem, if...we have 2 conditions: I am pregnant (6 months) and for me it is hard to use bath and with me is my grandmother, she is 75! I told this information to reception, but they could not provide us the serves we want and expect. And we choosed this hotel, because we have head and read, that here we can find the best service in Paris! We will have vocations using one shower for everyone :))

Reviews.Title: “Most important differentiation point - best hotel bar by some distance”
Reviews.Author: Darren J
Reviews.Content: Whilst rooms and service are somewhat omparable across all best Parisian peers, Plaza's bar is the most trendy by some distance. The other choice comes down to mainly location preference - eiffel tower or place vendome

Reviews.Title: “Best Palace in Paris, with the best ever breakfast”
Reviews.Author: meherio
Reviews.Content: Away from the usual travel to French Polynesia, Paris was on the list for this year's long awaited vacation and part of our 23 wedding anniversary celebration. Where to stay one may ask?. So many new taunted instant classics came on the Hotel scene in Paris offering international flavors and the forever classics offer their incomparable location and years of perfecting the art of pampering guests. The Plaza Athenee became our instant choice. The location was among tour top reason for the stay, on Avenue Montaigne with the Fashion houses flagship stores , the Champs Elysees a few steps away and also the proximity ( and view for some suites) of the Eiffel Tower. That alone is an instant reminder when you wake up from the fog of jet lag where you are. Not too many hotels can offer that in Paris. My wife is also a 'Sex in the City â€œ fan, if the Plaza was the choice for Carey for a place to stay in Paris, it had to be the one for us too. The arrival at the hotel offered the first greeting from doorman who welcomed us by name. We must have been among the few scheduled to check in early for that day and yet what a personal touch right there. Check in was expedient and very courteous. The sales manager Julie also came to the front desk to greet us. Right there, on the first impression, the Plaza differs from the other Palaces in Paris, no stuffy attitude from the staff and omnipresent fear that you are not quite dressed to the level of the secret dress code. One really feels instantly at home there. Our Suite was instantly available. From the batch of the newly renovated suite with the classical dÃ©cor. The first impression was to be welcomed in someone's home. That feeling is so rare nowadays when hotels spend fortunes with A list designers who focus more on overpriced decorative touches and exotic materials that could be found in New York, Singapore or Sydney than offering that touch that reminds you where you are. Classical french was our room. The television was also cleverly disguised as a old fashion mirror in a guilded frame that only appeared right in the middle of the frame when needed like magic thanks to the two way mirror. A Tv menu guide you through the maze of all the domestic and international channels offered catering to most languages. The Suite on the first floor faced the courtyard. This was not of importance to us since most of the daytime would be spent outside anyway and short of getting the Corner top floor suite with the view of Paris, how long does one spends at the window to watch the traffic passing by on the Avenue Montaigne? The King size Bed offered the right support with a choice of pillows. We could also order from the pillow menu to take care of allergy , firmness (or lack there of) and other fillings if needed. A rare feature in any hotel was the night lights setting that offer a safe mid night passage to respond to nature's call. The dressing cupboard was well appointed and offered ample room to unpack and stow our luggage away. The hotel had also offered the service of a maid to unpack for us if we wished so. There is a 110 V power outlet for the international visitor in need to re-charge their cell phones or other gizmos. The Bathroom was roomy and well appointed with among the largest bathtub ever found in a hotel (being 6 Ft 3, I could finally fit in !). The Shower located on the other side of the sink also offered the right amount of water pressure to take all the aches and pain from the travel away. The warm towel at the end was the best touch. Definitely need one Towel warmer rack at home ! You can leave your hair dryer home since one is provided by the hotel. The toilet offers the latest in Japanese technology for that â€œafter businessâ€� moment. Most refreshing to say the very least ! Service is fast and efficient throughout our stay, a discreet light switch allowed for the room service to know that we were ready for the turn down of the bed. A quick stop by the House keeper also ensured that we had everything we needed for the night. Breakfast at the Plaza is a must. It takes place main dining room that over looks the Christmas decorated courtyard with the skating rink. The Pastries and bread selection was worth every penny. Freshly baked, it comes with it's own pastry dictionary to describe the different variations of croissants, chocolate roll and fruit filled pastries. The Jam selection also feature seasonal flavors like fig for our meal. Before leaving the hotel a stop at the Concierge desk offered the needed maps, advices, VIP passes for the Musee d'Orsay (that alone was the best given tip by the sales manager when we checked in. they even suggested the off peak time to get there. So Shopping could be done in the morning: a stop by the christmas windows of Le Printemps and Galleries lafayette, Exotic jams and teas at Fauchon and Hediard place de la Madeleine, Sailor knit sweaters at St James and of course a Macaron and gifts run at Laduree rue Royale. The Afternoon at the musee was as promised, no wait in line and lighter loads of visitors ( compared with an hour later when every tourist in Paris decided to come to the musee. Missing to the collection was unfortunately the magpie from Claude Monet ( a personal favorite). Also check for the dining room hours for lunch, do not even think to get in 15 minutes before the closing of the lunch window right before the tea service. The attitude was definitely Parisian ! Back to our cocoon for the end of the afternoon. I had arranged with the sales manager for a visit of other potential suites in preparation of our 25th wedding anniversary stay. The key element was to get a stay to remember. The hotel offers 2 main decorative themes: classic and the Art deco rooms, suites and apartment. The Title of :â€� The room with The viewâ€� was found on the 8th floor in an Art Deco themed ( named the Suite Terrasse Eifel (room 888) with the panorama of Paris right in front of your eyes absolutely unobstructed. A private terrace offers yet a better setting for breakfast (weather permitting). The adjacent suite 889 also offers the view of the Grand dame of Paris. The Bar seems to be the place to be and be seen in Paris. We preferred the quieter tables in the corridor for a late Coffee and pastries watching the world go by. The home made chocolate ice cream is simply to die for (for the chocoholics out there) and the exotic fruits vacherin was simply divine. Our early departure forced us to get room service with the same breads , croissants and jams we had enjoyed the previous morning. The breakfast was delivered to the minute at the requested time. Checking out of the hotel was expedient and without fuss, the Luggage porter was in the room within minutes, the bill was ready at the desk and our Taxi was waiting to take us back to the airport. We have found our home away from home in Paris and would be hard pressed to try anything else! Counting the days until we return!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the same league as George V”
Reviews.Author: xcelr8
Reviews.Content: General staff attitude just OK. Breakfast was nothing special for what you paid. Staff certainly would not win any friends. Room (Suite) was large and spacious but in general quite noisy - I would not stay here again because of this and the service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at plaza”
Reviews.Author: bribri2809
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Plaza for my birthday in september for 4 nights. The service was excellent, we were greeted by no less than 3 managers at different time. The room was beautiful but i wanted one with view of avenue Montaigne not a wall witch they gave us. So my husband asked for an upgrade that we paid for a beautiful suite on avenue Montaigne. It was beautiful with view of Eiffel Tower! The breakfast every morning was wonderful with the freshest ingredients. Lunch at lounge Galerie was excellent with people watching.Didn't like the tiny claustrophobic elevator but preferred the beautiful staircase. Walls are very thin, every morning we could hear very loud arabic television through the wall next door. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. Very very expensive but once in a lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not surprised why Plaza Athenee is not top 20 on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: purple_dots
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Plaza Athenee and seriously doubt if I would even spend another night on my next trip. I think there are better choices around the area (Four Seasons) or even on Rue St Honore. I guess it is the place to stay if you want to be on avenue Montaigne (but I recommend Hotel Tremoille which is just around the corner) and if you wanted the experience of staying at the Plaza Athenee. Despite it all, I find the place cold and service not up to expectations. Biggest complain is the level of housekeeping that is inconsistent. Our toilets seemed to be cleaned on alternate days. The hotel itself has a beautiful facade but fails to impress within. Maybe I am fussy but no, I have stayed another Dorcherter Collection hotel in Milan and the experience and comfort of the rooms were far exceeded expectations. Only consolation was dining at Alain Ducasse which was truly memorable but that's a separate review altogether. Well, at least I can say, been there done that - not going down that route again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel--not an excellent value though”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusCharles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for 6 nights at the Plaza. The hotel is beautiful, staff friendly and warm, room was great, but it is by far the most expensive hotel I have ever stayed in. Felt my last trip to Paris was a much better value. While I have no complaints about the service, but when my dinner companion who is a Manhattan based hedge fund manager, is complaining that the prices are too high fat the bar...it is expensive. Felt other Paris hotels are a better value. However, this location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: ELBrenno
Reviews.Content: Spent to nights in the PA that are unforgettable - Amazing service - the best surroundings an location - difficult to find a better hotel in Paris. Paris at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you get a suite !”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and I must say that my first impression was NOT good. The staff there had serious attitude problems, especially if your French is not great. I booked a basic room (cost: EUR 600) and when I went to my room, it was like 200 sq feet which even for Paris is ridiculously small. I tried to sleep after my long flight but my room faced the court yard and there was a special event that day and it was unbelievably noisy. I called to try to get a quieter room but I was told that they only had suites available. I had to pay extra to change to the suite but they gave me a discount. The suite was 50 times better than the basic room and it made such a big difference. The courtyard of the hotel is beautiful. It's right on Avenue Montaigne and when you walk out, you have all these fancy shops just steps away! The location is unbeatable but I'd only stay here if you get a suite!

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its best”
Reviews.Author: wilfried_graebert
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Plaza Athenee - I was going to Batimat and my wife shopping. This was the perfect location for our trip. I returned to the Athenee after several years - it felt like home at once again. We were greeted by name and the service was excelent. We were updated to a spacious junior suite with a window to the courtyard. That was nice as we could open the window without street noise. The breakfast was great and the restaurant outstanding. The only negative surprise was a way to high charge for the internet - with the room prices they are charging this should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on plaza athenee attitude problem of its employees”
Reviews.Author: Mohamedtaher
Reviews.Content: I'm Mohamed Taher the owner of resorts in sharm el sheikh one of the top ten on trip advisor last year during my honeymoon in December I was a guest at plaza athenee and I paid more than 12000 euro for junior suite and I came back to Paris November 2011 in anther five stars hotel and when I passed by plaza athenee yesterday at 11:30 to have a drink at the lobby bar the head waiter wearing glasses in beige and the waiter Japanese in black refused to welcome us though the lobby was empty completely with only three tables being serviced can't imagine that a five star hotel would act like this shame on your service I will never stay there again they put me in a very bad situation as I had guests with me and I toook them and went to four seasons george v my reservation last year is under the name Mohamed Taher rizk

Reviews.Title: “The La Grande Dame of Avenue Montaigne”
Reviews.Author: Teresa L
Reviews.Content: Absolutely magnificant.The Hotel Athenee is located in the most beautiful part of the city of Paris, "the golden triangle".It is by far the hotel of destination for the most sophicated of travelers from around the world.From the moment you arrive you are treated with the utmost service money can buy. This property is simply above and beyond, The rooms are just gorgeous and the service is five star. I had lunch in the courtyard , it was just incedible with a setting to die, for not to mention the food and service was supurb. After lunch I strolled down Avenue Montaigne for an afternoon of shopping in the most exqusite stores and boutiques in all of this world. What a wayto lavish oneself in this beatiful city of Paris. It doesn't get much better than this .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris..”
Reviews.Author: Yankeedoc
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, very romantic rooms, excellent service, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unwelcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Louis F
Reviews.Content: During summer my family and I had been shopping along Avenue Montaigne and decided to stop for a couple of bottles of Cristal to enjoy the afternoon with. When we arrived at the La Terrace restaurant we were ignored by the manager and when we finally got his attention he said there was no room for us to sit outside, I did not mind this at all as it was lunch time. He then suggested to us to go into the bar inside the hotel to go to the bar and to drink champagne there. We then began to walk to the entrance when the anger hurried after us and exclaimed that we would not be allowed into the hotel as I was not wearing long trouser. instead as I was smartly dressed with a shirt and smart White shorts however apparently this was not acceptable to him and he rudely asked us to leave and go somewhere else. I did not expect this treatment off a hotel from the Dorchester collection as all I wanted to do was enjoy Cristal after shopping.

Reviews.Title: “The Quintessential Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mse1125
Reviews.Content: After about two dozen trips to Paris in my lifetime...the Plaza Athenee inhabits my spirit as the most French of all things French. Not showy in an American style ( like the Four Seasons has felt, for me) but more restrained and low-key, it welcomes you in a refined way....from the entry ( with a scent of perfume wafting at all times) to the rooms, one feels comforted in that it feels as if you are taken back in time. The Gobelins Bar is a true people-watching paradise ( My husband and I were there once during Fashion Week...and it was a virtual catwalk of fashion models and followers!) Breakfast in the dining room was a delight....and the air of big business was evident at almost every table. Crackling croissants and lovely jams, with waiters appearing to whisk away any wayward crumbs...a truly delectable visit is to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious - a little too modern in parts but glorious all the same - this is how to run a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChDYquem
Reviews.Content: It does everything so well and the Relais Plaza on the side is so cute and talented, their food is wonderful, I loved the food in Ducasse just like I do when I eat it in London, I'm just not sure about the decor. It is very hard to choose between this and the Meurice so you have to toss a coin, but it's a wonderful hotel and you will adore your time here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True!”
Reviews.Author: louise1809
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Paris at the Plaza Athenee to celebrate my 40th Birthday, and all I can say is WOW! I waited and saved for 3 years to make the trip perfect, as it was my first time in Paris - I wanted to stay at the Plaza, and have dinner in the Eiffel Tower, and both were just amazing, so worth the wait! The staff welcomed us in a very warm friendly way, and put us right at ease, we had a beautiful room, overlooking the Ave Montaigne and side view of the Eiffel Tower, which was almost surreal! Breakfast was divine - the pastries are a sight to behold, and we enjoyed tea in the Galerie des Goblins, expensive but fantastic. I loved it all, and I will never forget this magical experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: bintpittsburghpa
Reviews.Content: Everyone should treat themselves to a stay at the Athenee, if only for one night. First class service, first class everything. We stayed four nights and arranged from the United States to stay at another hotel to sample something different. We actually came back to the Athenee from our other hotel just to visit the staff and have a drink. We should have left the other so-called top notch hotel and re-booked Athenee. Everyone was exceptionally kind especially Gabriel and Battiste. We ate dinner at the restaurant and cannot stop talking about it. Definitely will stay here my next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Plaza Athenee always perfect”
Reviews.Author: richardrollins
Reviews.Content: Paris is Paris. Hotel Plaza Athenne is Paris as Paris can be. It is truly a beautiful Hotel with much history and all that goes with it. However this Hotel is perfect and deserves itall. The staff is great. The rooms are truly outstanding. The location is over the top. The moment you walk into the Hotel you know you are at a very special place. Every time I have stayed there it is always exactly the same - Perfect. The attention to detail is so special. Tea is an extraordinary experience here. Yes this Hotel is expensive. But it is worth the price if you can afford it. This is Paris at its best. Richard C. Rollins

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time”
Reviews.Author: ssn12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2009, but I was unable to select the date. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and to be fair there is nothing really bad to say. Only that the rooms are a little small and old fashioned, but for some people that is the charm of the hotel. The bathrooms are also small. The location of this hotel is amazing and we hardly went anywhere in a car or taxi. I really enjoyed the courtyard for eating in the hotel, and their bar is legendary in itself. We did use their fitness center, which was well equipped (though not as good as I've seen in some other hotels). We enjoyed our stay here, but I don't think we will be back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Fantasy”
Reviews.Author: jetsetprincess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you imagined when you dream about Paris and all its luxuries. From the second you see the hotel and its beautiful red awnings, you know you are about to step into a world of fantasy. The staff greet you and are extremely accommodating. The regular rooms are small but beautiful with lavish curtains and molded ceilings. The suites with the living rooms are large and very nice. The food in the hotel is excellent. I love the terrace bar. It's one of the most beautiful restaurants I have ever been to, you are outside in the hotels garden. Room service is a bit slow but very nice food. At night there is a bar inside which is kind of quiet but has a very nice trendy crowd that typically get drinks there and then go to a club after. There is a small gym in the hotel and also a Dior Spa. If you have a pet you can bring little dogs there. If you are going to Paris and want to live out your Parisian fantasy... then the only place to stay is at the Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay over Easter”
Reviews.Author: TripsAreFunYAY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris for a birthday weekend over Easter 20211 and the service at this hotel is top notch. We're Americans and I speak French, though my boyfriend does not. When we checked in our room was not ready yet so they compâ€™ed our drinks at the bar when while we waited, which was a nice touch. The drinks at the hotel bar areas are quite pricey, I think my martini was around 25 euros. Worth stopping in though for sure. As for the service, the front desk is incredibly helpful. Because of Easter we weren't sure when things would be open, and every time we asked at the front desk theyâ€™d give us helpful tips. For instance, we werenâ€™t sure if the Louvre was closed on Easter and when we asked they gave us tickets to skip the line (put on our bill of course). When was asked which department stores would be open, they let us know just Lafayette (I think) and they gave us a discount card to use on our purchases there. We also did the boat cruise and got those tickets right at the front desk. It made things so much easier. The rooms are also fantastic. Tons of room, just so relaxing. On Easter they also gave us a big painted chocolate Easter egg, filled with chocolate bars. All in all it was really fantastic. We loved it and would obviously stay again. Thereâ€™s a good reason itâ€™s rated one of the best hotels in Paris! You canâ€™t go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious ambience, exceptional food and a treasure trove wine list!”
Reviews.Author: Gt3driver
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Sunday to spend a free day in Paris solely at this hotel on our way back home. Hotel is in a great location for shopping as all the great designers are at your doorstep. Room not quite ready but Pierre the receptionist made sure we were immediately shown to an available room with no fuss. Room was well appointed and spacious, which was great as we had been driving from burgundy via Versailles since early in the morning. We decided in advance to have dinner in the beautiful internal courtyard and had pre arranged an older vintage of rare wine to have with dinner, food and wine were immaculate and worth the trip to the hotel! After dinner we tried the alco Popsicles at the cool bar. Stephanie the manager on duty on the day of departure ensured we were completely satisfied with our stay at the Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “An unbelievable experience!”
Reviews.Author: laureng_33
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, my husband and I booked our first night at the Plaza Athenee before travelling around the rest of France. I had initially tried to book the 'romance package' listed on their website for this special occasion, however, it was unavailable at this time. I still went ahead, booking a deluxe room. Our 9 hour flight arrived early in the morning and we arrived at the hotel at 11am. Unfortunately, our room was not ready for us so we had some water in the gorgeous 'La Galerie des Gobelins' before wandering around to explore Paris. Since we were quite exhausted from travelling, we checked back twice before our room was finally ready for us at 3pm (the expected check-in time). It was absolutely worth the wait! The room was beautifully decorated with a terrace having a spectacular view of the Avenue Montaigne and the Eiffel Tower. It was an amazing experience to watch the light show at night from our terrace. For me, this was a dream come true. In addition, there was a bottle of champagne for us in the room with a lovely note from Charles, the assistant manager, wishing us a wonderful stay. On that note, I cannot say enough about the superb staff at this hotel. Everyone was so gracious and welcoming. The turn-down service was also great, with fluffy slippers and bottles of water waiting for us after we returned from dinner. It was exactly what we needed after our long day of travelling. We would consider ourselves extremely lucky to have the opportunity to stay at this amazing hotel in the future. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel & Resort Offers Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: columbuscirclenyc
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Athenee in Paris, through Luxury Hotel & Resorts, offers a rate that supposedly includes an upgrade when available (hotel was more than half empty but no upgrade offered); an 80 euro meal credit (when you check in you find out it is only useable at a hallway cafe and only at lunch) and in an in-room amenity (not offered). Also the hotel attempted to charge the rate in euros, not in dollars quoted on the Luxury Hotel website, a 50% overcharge. Also they have a 24 euro a day charge to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate Paris hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TiTiTG
Reviews.Content: A once in a lifetime experience, from entering the lobby, having tea in the salon, a Kir Royal in the bar, dining in the Alain Ducasse restaurant. The rooms are small but elegant, and the bathrooms perfect. If you've got the money, and you like the right bank location, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “room service at night”
Reviews.Author: emiliacarlotta
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the presidential suite , called to order the breakfast after dinner . I was leaving quite early, at 9.30 and we stayed late with some friends, so, I new that I will get a short sleep. At 5 in the morning someone was knocking at the door and wake me up. I tried not to listen but it didn't stop. Finally I went to the door and the waiter was there with some drinks.....after hi said sorry and left.....the breakfast had some thinks missing and some wrong....so, my night was not relaxing at all and I felt tired the next day and needed to work.....

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethS4
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed when I had breakfast recently at what had been my favorite home away from home. I first came to Paris with My parents when I was 2 and we stayed at the Plaza Athenee, and I had been staying there nearly every year ever since. I had one of my wedding receptions there. I had a group of friends stay there when my older daughter was baptized there. However, we began staying with friends about four years ago, but I always stop for tea or breakfast every day at PA. This time, however, the hotel seemed like a different place. It seemed colorless, and dark. It seemed like the staff has changed as well. The familiar faces in the Gallery were gone, in fact, all the familiar faces were gone. My favorite scrambled eggs were good, yes, but not like they used to be. It seemed that it was full of "professional" women, and terribly low class men. I have NEVER been a fan of the Ritz, but I must say, the atmosphere evoked what the Plaza Athenee used to. I was so disappointed and quite saddened by this. I hope that the current management decides to change it back to the glorious grande dame that the Plaza Athenee once was, and deserves to be!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Birthday Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndiJ_AJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 46th birthday, orginally booked in for 3 nights and because we were enjoying it so much went downstairs and booked another night. We didnt want to leave!! We were in Paris on a holiday and booked this as a mini break from the accomodation we were staying in to celebrate my birthday. We arrived by taxi and from the moment we stepped out of it were treated fabulously. A wonderful welcome and a lovely lovely upgrade to a gorgeous suite overlooking the Avenue and Eiffel because it was my birthday :) Merci Plaza! The room was sumptous and beautiful and full of luxury touches, a walk in dressing room, huge suite, pillow menu with excellent choices, luxury soaps and toiletries you absolutely couldnt fault the place. A lovely fruit platter and champagne awaited us when we got to our room which was a nice touch. We ate our breakfast in the restuarant downstairs each morning and the staff were welcoming and attentive to our every need and want. Each night a wonderful lady came and turned down our bed and attended to anything we wanted and was lovely to talk to about Paris and France in general. On the first morning (my birthday) as we went to leave the hotel it was raining but no problem we were shown into a taxi and presented with the hotel's signature red umbrellas to keep us dry on our day out at Les Invalides and the Rodin. Upon our return to the hotel we had afternoon tea in the salon, just couldnt fault the lovely juices and beautiful canapes and again the staff, marvellous. When we got back to our room because it was my birthday another lovely bottle of champagne awaited us and a wonderful birthday gift of a signature red leather baggage tag with a handwritten note wishing me a happy birthday awaited me. Each night we ate room service and the food was sublime. Upon the final night's meal when I ate what had been the best fish Id ever tasted and I wrote a lovely note to the chef thanking him for this and all the wonderful meals we had enjoyed and a lovely platter of petit fours was sent up with his compliments. Merci! My husband booked in and enjoyed the Dior institute spa downstairs 3 times and said that the massages were marvellous he felt very relaxed after each one. I basically wanted to move in to the hotel and just sing its praises to all and sundry and still will if they will have me haha it just couldnt be faulted for a luxury break or a longer term stay, one of Paris' finest. Viva Plaza!!!!! J'adore Vous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosebudand007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Plaza for 3 nights in a Superior Suite for my 40th. It was an amazing hotel and the most amazing customer service we have ever had. My wife and I are very fortunate to have stayed in a lot of the great hotels/resorts of the world and the service we received at the Plaza was the best we'd ever experienced. This was largely down to the Guest Relations Director Louise Prevost, who was exceptional. It is of course an expensive hotel and an expensive city, but I cannot imagine going to Paris again and not stying back at the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LazyPoint
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights here. We loved the hotel. Great location. Service was excellent. At breakfast one morning there was a slight delay in delivering our omelets. It was hardly a delay and we enjoyed the relaxed pace. When we got back to our room after a day on the town we found a small package with a note apologizing for the delay. In the box was as beautiful leather card holder. A beautiful gesture for a very minor service issue. We loved out stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: 33avenue
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience! Oui! Oui! Oui! From the time the hostess picked us up at the exit of the plane (yes, you read that correctly), walked us through baggage claim and customs, and guided us to our chauffeur, everything was flawless! I actually double checked with the concierge if the hostess would be at the arrival area or at the exit of the plane as I thought it might have been a language issue. But, no, they confirmed that we will be picked up right at the plane. Wow, such VIP service. In addition, upon arrival at the hotel, the doorman and receptionist greeted us with our names even before I uttered a word. More on Paris and pictures here: http://deuxarmoires.wordpress.com/2011/03/22/paris/

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in every way!”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler_ct
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend in Paris at Plaza Athenee. I rarely write the reviews, but after so many years of traveling and staying at the world's best hotels it is truly a pleasure to share my experiences. The hotel management and staff have thought of absolutely everything to make one's stay perfect. You notice that the second you arrive. Small detail, which I have not seen anywhere else -- the moment the valet helps you out of the car and retrieves the luggage, he instantly reads off your name from airline tag and just like that he knows how to welcome you! The same person then walks you to the reception and announces to the staff there who has arrived. From that point forward you feel that everybody knows your name. I realize that none of this is by accident. The staff is extremely professional and always genuinely stands ready to help. Another nice touch is that Guest Relations representative comes out to greet you at reception and introduce herself. Overall, this is a fantastic and magical hotel, which is small enough to feel personal attention, but yet big enough to have fully staffed Concierge Desk, amazing spa and, of course, all the glamor one would expect in Paris. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “j'adore plaza athenee!!”
Reviews.Author: mushmush
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel with very helpful staff. gorgeous lobby and rooms. i loved my co worker's rooms as they were so traditional french in decor, but for some reason my room was modern and had no french furniture which was disappointing. in my opinion all the rooms should have traditional french decor. but either way everything was lovely. i was blown away by the opulence and elegance. i have also stayed at le meurice which is also gorgeous, but i do think athenee one ups le meurice in luxury. especially when you have $100 USD room service breakfast with just poached eggs, some kiwi, yogurt and tea! but, that's what luxury is all about right? i loved all the huge oil portraits in the halls, i am guessing they are antique and not reproductions. this is one fabulous hotel! oh and by the way, a few of us think the hotel is definitely haunted. i for one can attest some very strange happenings in the night. i am obsessed with the idea of ghosts, and have not had really any experiences besides my last stay at athenee. i even googled if the hotel was indeed haunted and found nothing, but maybe the hotel management can comment on whether the hotel is haunted by some old parisian souls??

Reviews.Title: “So excited about this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise1809
Reviews.Content: I have been saving for three years for my 40th Birthday trip to Paris, place of my dreams - the Eiffel Tower, the Food, the French style - the Plaza will have it all and I simply cannot wait!!! Roll on September, when I hope all my dreams come true!

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from scrambled eggs”
Reviews.Author: JEGSTER
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, extras are horrifically expensive. Goblin alley makes for good entertainment. Hard to fault this hotel other than the very average scrambled egg at breakfast. The classic scrambled eggs were a miss! On a serious note, the egg chef should take some lessons from Le Meurice where the simple scrambled eggs are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkib10
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to stay at Hotel Plaza Athenee as a surprise during our stay in Paris. I was speechless from the moment we arrived outside. We were welcomed and personally shown through the hotel and taken up to our room (a Junior Suite) and shown all of its features. The room was beautifully decorated and furnished with a huge comfortable bed and massive bathroom. We were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower. The evening turn down service was fantastic and we came back after an evening out to find our bed ready for sleeping in and our drapes drawn. There is nothing the hotel won't do to make your stay more comfortable. My partner proposed to me during our stay and the hotel staff helped him with the surprise. The one let down was the quality of the meal we ordered from room service. It was very expensive and not at all satisfactory for what we paid for it. However, the pastries we had later in the evening were fantastic! As was the complimentary mandarin cake that was in the room with champagne on arrival. This was bar far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in - and will likely ever stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: Edward2010
Reviews.Content: It only gets better, I've stayed there few times over the years, I travel a lot to upscale hotels and by far this one tops my list. The location, the friendliness of the staff, the concierge services, the attention to details is unmatched. Every guest is treated like royalty, for the money you pay this may be the cheapest hotel considering what get in return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem of a hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: jadurra
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked into the Plaza Athenee, the service was outstanding. The entire staff is there to anticipate your every need. We stayed at the hotel in August, when they had a special promotion. At the time we booked the reservation, they upgraded our room one level. We stayed in an elegant suite. The bathroom was enormous by anyone's standard and very luxurious. The hotel is located in a quiet part of town and surrounded by designer boutiques. I can't wait to return! My only criticism is that the Wifi was not free. When you pay such high rates, I don't understand why it is not included in the price of the room. This was the only hotel during our 16 day vacation in France where Wifi was not complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust101_10
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Paris, I stay at the Plaza. The staff is so helpful and friendly, the rooms are amazing and so clean, the beds so comfortable, they even have a huge pillow selection (various fillings) to accommodate everyone's special needs, the restaurants are delicious, even the room service is no regular room service, the bar is amazingly beautiful and a place to be,.... There isn't one bad word to be said about the Plaza. The staff bends backwards to accommodate every single wish and desire. Truly amazing, I wish every travel experience could be like this! Ok, there's one thing that comes to my mind that hasn't been perfect for a couple of years now: although all their spa treatments are heaven, their massages are not great, there is definitely need for improvement and exploration of what a real deep tissue or Swedish massage needs to feel like. But that's really nothing, as everything else is so wonderfully perfect (and I found a solution by having an outside masseuse come to the hotel when I do need a real massage)

Reviews.Title: “excellent but expensive”
Reviews.Author: nmieke
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time staying at the Plaza Athenee. This is one of the most glamorous and elegant hotels in the world. We stayed in a junior suite which was quite nice but very expensive. We always request the Parisian style rooms (vs the art deco style) and the design is beautiful. It was fashion week in Paris during our visit and the hotel was very busy. My one complaint being when we first arrived, we sat down in the salon for a coffee/snack and were told we couldn't sit in the seats we had decided upon (prime seats in the middle of the salon). They escorted us to a back table by the elevator (practically in the hallway). I complained that the table was not acceptable so another employee came over and asked us if we were guests of the hotel. I replied yes and we were then seated us at another table in the corner that was ok but not as horrible as the one by the elevator. We definitely felt snubbed and considering we were paying close to $2000 a night, it seemed unnecessary and snobby seeing the other tables were available. Aside from that, the concierge is excellent and helped with our many requests. The breakfast in the dining room is wonderful and the room is beautiful. We had 2 massages and mine was quite good but my husband was not happy with his therapist. The spa facilities are quite nice and the steam/sauna are excellent. I did think the bed was very uncomfortable and the worst we slept during our European vacation (we stayed at the Connaught London, Berkeley London and Grand Hotel Cap Ferrat). The bed could definitely use some sort of mattress pad or pillow top. It was rock hard and hurt my back. Not sure if we will go back or try the Ritz or George X next time mainly b/c of the bed not the snub.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: The first impression when you enter the elegant lobby after being greeted by the very friendly doorman is the scent of amber. The building is an interesting mix of Art Deco, Art Nouveau, classic French style and modern elements (bar, main dining room). The hotel has been gradually redecorated but has kept its charm. Like the sister hotel the Dorchester in London, all the public spaces are now occupied by bars or restaurants, which is unfortunate. You can hardly sit in the gallery or the courtyard and not eat or drink. Since I had a suite, this did not bother me too much, but it makes the place less relaxed than it should be. The room (Junior Suite) was superbly equipped (advanced lighting system, 115 TV stations, 24 radio stations) and had a view of the gorgeous inner courtyard (fountain, singing birds). Brown marble bathroom, also with courtyard view, elegant toiletries. I tried different options for food and drinks: a light lunch in the intimate gallery, lunch at the beautiful Relais Plaza (very ritzy and an Art Deco gem, good value for lunch), unusual drinks at the bar (great staff but the electronic menu is OTT and far too complicated to use). If you do not want to spend a fortune at the main restaurant (Alain Ducasse), you can just have breakfast there. While still expensive for a breakfast, it is great: beautiful menus and decor, unusual fresh juices, superior viennoisseries, toasted Poilane bread, Corsican honey, jams from Hediard (including one made for the PA with red currant and geranium), etc. Great service with the F&B manager present and visibly trying to do the best for the guests. The Dior spa is a great improvement and I loved the decoration. The new fitness is larger than it used to be, the saunas are good for a city hotel and there is a very nice relaxation area next to the reception of the spa. The level of service is consistently very high but I noticed a few minor slips since earlier stays: reservation agent not as good, no more call / visit by the housekeping after check-in to make sure everything is ok, unfriendly staff at the reception of the spa. Overall, though, the Plaza Athenee, while very expensive, remains a very special place and one of the great city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Probably the most perfect hotel experience we've ever had. The location is outstanding, the hotel and rooms are gorgeous, and the service is unfailingly topnotch. The concierge desk is so helpful that it's easy to become wholly dependent on them. The restaurant staff made every effort to accommodate our large party at breakfast and dinner, whatever the need - nobody there passed the buck and the experience there is clearly a team effort. An outstanding base for a memorable Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: johannalobato
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Plaza Athenee for only 1 night since they couldnt guarantee me the Eiffel tower view from a junior suite. Everything about the hotel is great. the service is exceptional. I was given a junior suite with a beautiful view of the avenue and the tower. I regretted changing hotels. The second hotel didnt compare. I'm going back to Paris next year and the only hotel I will stay at is Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “Charles the Concierge is a legend”
Reviews.Author: CornwallHelen
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed her for two nights. The staff and the whole experience was amazing. Charles the Concierge did his utmost to care for us the whole time he was there and the staff in general spoke to you as friends and it was a pleasure to be surrounded by such warmth. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. Food in the restaurant was outstanding, along with the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Plaza Athenee-wow,,,hotel...”
Reviews.Author: akshit_kemp
Reviews.Content: indows open onto either the avenue Montaigne, lined with magnificent chestnut trees, the peaceful Cour Jardin, the rooftops of Montmartre or even a side view of the Eiffel Tower. All the rooms and suites have king, queen or twin beds and most rooms offer a connecting room. Luxury, comfort, technology, security and of course the legendary Plaza AthÃ©nÃ©e warm welcome are synonymous with a wonderful stay in Paris... ll the staff were friendly and helpful, it felt like a luxurious home away from home. The room was quiet, dark at night time and a superbly comfortable, if firm, bed. We had been upgraded to a deluxe room which was spacious, plenty of closet space, and a view of the Eiffel Tower when you looked out to the right out of the window

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Perfection”
Reviews.Author: JoGirlMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I was taken to Paris as a surprise by my partner, who proposed to me whilst we were there. He booked the Plaza Athenee after I mentioned it (due to it's appearance in the final episode of the Sex and the City tv series). It was super lovely from start to finish. Although we arrived some time before scheduled check in (8am) they said they would get our room ready as soon as possible - they had been fully booked the night before - and offered us the use of the fitness centre to freshen up and asked if we would care for breakfast in the dining room. We had breakfast - superb - and left for a walk. The hotel called about 2 hours later advising us our room was ready. When we returned, a staff member walked us to our room and pointed out all the facilities for our use. All the staff were friendly and helpful, it felt like a luxurious home away from home. The room was quiet, dark at night time and a superbly comfortable, if firm, bed. We had been upgraded to a deluxe room which was spacious, plenty of closet space, and a view of the Eiffel Tower when you looked out to the right out of the window. A most delicious welcome cake was in our room in arrival. We had treatments in the couples room at the Dior Institut spa on the premises....amazing treatment, beautiful surroundings. My partner had organised, through the concierge, for a hairdresser to come and blowdry my hair in our hotel room. He was lovely and did a great job. My partner also approached the concierge telling him he was going to propose to me and asked about venues, retaurants etc. The Concierge recommended a cruise on the Yachts de Paris, which is where he popped the question, and it was a divine experience. I could go on and on about this hotel and all that I love - having champagne and appetisers in the beautiful "Galeries", the bar, the sidewalk dining, the restaurant breakfasts (the BEST grapefruit juice, pastries I have ever had), it is truly a beautiful place to stay and view Paris from. We unfortunately did not get a chance to dine in the Alain Ducasse restaurant so I cannot comment. It's not an inexpensive hotel to stay at, and therefore nothing is inexpensive there, but you would be silly to expect it to be. My room service cheeseburger, possibly the most expensive cheeseburger I have eaten (at about 40 euros) was the most delicious! I loved this hotel and really hope to go back there soon. It was a truly magical 5 days. For a romantic no expense spared getaway, I believe you could not beat this.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Paris”
Reviews.Author: discerningNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from out 4th stay at the Plaza Athenee. It is a wonderfully, luxurious and elegant hotel with magnificent rooms and suites. We were upgraded to a suite with a beautiful wood-paneled living room and gorgeous moldings throughout both rooms. The interior design is very French and old-world although all the modern amenities for 2010 are there. The bathroom, which was very large, is all marble with gorgeous fixtures , as one would expect at a hotel of this caliber. The staff is lovely and very helpful. The maid service is fabulous. The concierge was able to reserve at the top restaurants for us without any problem and was very helpful in answering all our questions. The hotel's location is wonderful. The Avenue Montagne is a beautiful shopping street. If you turn right out of the hotel you are looking at the Eiffel Tower in all its majesty across the Seine. Half a block to the left and you are at the gorgeous Rond Point, at one end of the Champs Elysee. The hotel is hugely expensive. However, for the visitor who wants a luxury, Parisian experience at its grandest and does not mind paying for it, the Plaza Athenee is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Aquacarpet
Reviews.Content: Pure luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spaceman028
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay from start to end. This hotel is chic and the bar is out of this world. The service was excellent and the location was great. Love the rooms. Very spacious and modern. The staff was very attentive and nice. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Top drawer hotel - one of the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: longjohnsilverLondon
Reviews.Content: Paris has a wide selection of great hotels, but the Plaza Athenee is right up there. I was in Paris on business, but made a long weekend of it with my Wife and we both adored the hotel. The room was charming and spacious by Paris standards, the service was excellent. Avenue Montaigne is a very smart street in Paris and you are within a convenient walking distance of many of the great sights of Paris. The food is excellent, although the Michelin starred restaurant (Alain Ducasse) was closed during the weekend. Try taking afternoon tea with some pastries in La Galerie des Gobelins. We both loved the very funky Le Bar du Plaza AthÃ©nÃ©e - great cocktails and background music. This is a chic Parisian gem and I would love to return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “'Place of Excellence'”
Reviews.Author: hempelLondon
Reviews.Content: Plaza in its own rights is an institutions where Royalty stays regularly. Great place and super additions recently. 'Place of Excellence', the Parisian 'symphony' of the Alain Ducasse Restaurant at the Plaza AthÃ©nÃ©e presents best of French Haute cuisine. The restaurant offers decisively contemporary French cuisine with a stress on genuineness in order to reveal the concealed flavours of the ingredients. In my opinion a great hotel like Plaza lacked such a special a place, they have now overcome that disadvantage, my only comment would be that the service in the restaurant needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Carrie Bradshaw lucked-out!”
Reviews.Author: tattnall
Reviews.Content: I'd been traveling to Paris regularly for 39 years, staying at dozens of different hotels, before I selected the Plaza Athenee for a week's stay. Carrie on the other hand, was lucky enough to stay there on her very first visit! Not only is this hotel my absolute favorite in a city filled with spectacular hotels - many of which I've stayed in - it is now my favorite hotel in the world. I've never been the recipient of such kindness from a hotel's staff. From the front desk personnel who made my visit by slipping me tickets to a long sold-out Grand Palais exhibition, to the incomparable Natasha, who greeted me and poured my coffee at breakfast each morning beneath the dazzling, "exploding crystals" chandeliers of six-star chef Alain Ducasse's restaurant. If you savor the indulgence of breakfasting at luxury hotels, you will think you've died and gone to heaven at the Plaza Athenee. And there can't be a better place in Paris to people-watch than the palatial corridor known as Galerie des Gobelins, where enjoying an aperitif I once observed Salma Hayek air-kissing Penelope Cruz. The guest rooms and suites are, as one would expect at these prices, breathtaking. You can easily view them on the hotel's website. What the website can't show you, and what will keep me coming back is the Plaza Athenee's staff, who greeted me each day as if my being a guest made their day. You can't PAY people to be that consistently gracious and friendly. (I spent 30 years in the hospitality industry; I know.) You must be savvy enough an employer to find them, and worthy enough to retain them. If I get to heaven, I hope the pearly gates look just like the entrance to the Plaza Athenee!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Swissmex
Reviews.Content: We always have tea and desserts at the George V when in Paris. It was full, so we went to the Plaza Athenee. No comparison in quality but same prices. The dessert was 16 EUR and served still in the little carton holder, kind of dry. Mediocre. Nobody refilled our cups. It is full of "new rich" people, just pretending to be cool. The staff were equally pretentious. The place is nice and ritzy, yes, but if you really want a similar experience but nice, go to the George V and stay away of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Athenee”
Reviews.Author: nanna-ivy64
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location, Plaza Athenee is very grand and elegant. Rooms are large and offer amazing views of the Eiffel Tower and down town Paris. Food and drinks in the hotel bar and restaurant is incredible, excellent attentive service. Hotel is on the best shopping street in Paris with every designer store you can want. Metro station is close by so the whole of Paris is only a train ride away. Cab from Paris airport is only around 30 mins ride.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: KarlaC2
Reviews.Content: My first trip over seas. I hope the next I go to Paris. I can enjoy with my kids. I really loved the city. I also wanna go when the weather is warmer. It was very cold in November.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: CloudPixie
Reviews.Content: I mentioned that I was a huge Sex and the City fan when I booked the hotel, and I was so excited to even be staying in the same hotel as Miss Bradshaw. We were offered complimentary drinks in the Salon as our room wasn't ready and when we were finally ushered up to the room we discovered that we had been upgraded to the beautiful suite that they had filmed in. I found the staff wonderfully attentive and genuinely warm, the service was impeccable. The Plaza Athenee is such a truly Parisian in style elegant and beautiful and the breakfast pastries were the best I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutchy 1943
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week at the Plaza Athenee last April. APRIL IN PARIS!! We more than enjoyed the friendly and professional staff at the Athenee. Could not ask for better anything. Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “I believe in miracles”
Reviews.Author: travellingKoalas
Reviews.Content: This was to celebrate a special birthday, and it also was the first day of a long awaited holiday. My wife and I had already spent about a week in the Plaza Athenee, a few years back, and had loved the place, and level of service, so it made sense to choose to go back. However, things did not start too smoothly... As we arrived by car, after quite a long journey, we were unable to drive up to the front door, as literally hundreds of people were crowding the pavement, holding pens and papers, waving cellphones ready to take photos. As it turned out, 'U2' was giving a concert in Paris, and happened to be staying at the Plaza. The doormen and concierges were overwhelmed by the crowd, and the cars were blocked by the crazed fans. After a very unpleasent few minutes of being trapped in our vehicle, we were finally rescued by one of the stylish doormen, who took away the car, and allowed us to run through the revolving doors, into the hotel. I had never seen the lobby so crowded before, taking away that all important feeling that you should get in a palace hotel, one of a tranquile, civilized retreat. But whole groups of people were just loitering, wandering aimlessly up and down the passage. Things only got worse when we arrived at the reception desk, to be told, apologetically, that our junior suite was not ready, and no other rooms were available for the moment. It was about 4o'clock. Not good. We were offered a complimentary drink, in the Hotel's bar in the foyer. We sat down at a little table, ordered Champagne, which was forgotten; asked again. The place was packed, resembling an airport lounge at times of big departures. Some of the U2 singers/players appeared, with their collosal bodyguards, and of course entering via a secret back door, leaving their fans without even the hope of a glimps. At this point, I was starting to regret having chosen the Plaza Athenee. Indeed, there are many beautiful hotels in Paris. We thought of the GeorgesV, very elegant, but lacks in authenticity, as many four seasons in big cities, they are a bit too standardized. The Ritz and the Crillon are wonderful properties, but are both in great need of renovation and up-dating. Then there was the Bristol, but a recent homicide took place there, between a young couple, roughly our age, which somehow put us off. The Meurice looked tempting, but not convenient for us, due to its location. So, Plaza Athenee it was. But right now, after this disastrous first impression, I realized that only a miracle would turn our stay into positive experience. And that is exactly what happened next. The very nice young man from reception came up to us, and told us that our room was still not ready. (It was coming up to 5'o clock by now). But, as an apology, would we accept to be upgraded into one of their Eiffel suite? Now, I had heard of those suites, they are a recent addition to the hotel , occupying the top floor of the building and is in fact a modern extension. There are about five or six of those enormous suites, mostly decorated in authentic 30's style, offering some of the finest accomodation in the whole of Paris, with unbelievable panoramic views of the 'old iron lady', which is how the French refer to the Eiffel tower. As we walked into the vast living room, with fabrics in subtle shades of grey, filled with valuable antiques, we were mezmorized by the sweeping views of the Paris roof-tops, and an entire, not a section, a whole Eiffel tower, shimmering in the hot july sun. A bottle of Champagne was brought in, with exquisit pastries, compliments of the hotel. Life started to be good again. We had made some appointements with the hotel's new spa by Dior, for a facial. The place, on the lower ground floor was predictably elegant, beautifully appointed, and the treatments, first class. Though I must just say that I find 180 euros for a facial, a bit steep in price, and could think of a few better ways to spend this amount. My wife disagrees. Back to the magical suite, where dusk was setting, we decided to dine in the hotel's smaller restaurant, the Relais Plaza. The main restaurant was closed, (Sunday), and anyhow, we really are not 'foodies'. We knew the Relais well, and love the setting, with it's traditional 1930's surrounds, based on the old cruise ship, 'The Normandy'. They now offer a very good value menu, at 44 euros, lunch or dinner, which is about the price of a single course in the Ã -la-carte, reminding one that we are in the middle of a global recession, or, as the French tend to say ten times a day, 'La crise!' But we choose a la cart dishes, and they were good, but really not spectacular for the price. But the service is very stylish, and the pianist, a welcomed element, in a rather empty dinning room. We returned to our room, where our tower awaited, lit up like a christmas tree. Reasonably early night, as we had a long drive to Geneva the next day. Wonderfully comfortable bed, great choice of pillows from the pillow menu; alas I was woken up twice, by some utter idiots, bellowing drunkenly, from a nearby terrasse, (possibly staying at the hotel), reminding me that crass stupidity knows no social nor financial bounds. Next morning, a delightful breakfast table was wheeled in, and positioned by the bay window in the sitting room. And it was delicious. So we left, with stars in our eyes, ambitiously wondering what we needed to do to afford this 7500 euros suite, on a regular basis. But that's what dreams are for. Though I must say that when we stayed in a deluxe room, we enjoyed equally high levels of service. The Plaza Athenee is a truely unique place, with beautiful rooms, the best service, and glorious location. It also blends with perfection tradition and modernity. So, in our view, can we say that it is the best hotel in Paris? Well, as somebody would say: ''Yes we can!!''

Reviews.Title: “Huge waste of money. Don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: KateGoesAway
Reviews.Content: There is nothing special about this hotel and for the money they charge there should be. Our suite had shabby furniture, was tired looking and had a noisy clocked that ticked all night long and kept us awake. Staff incredibly snooty and the bar was filled with an alarming predominance of sleazy older men. We had breakfast from room service and the coffee was abominable. We were expecting the vacation of a lifetime and we were all terribly disappointed. We could have and should have stayed at a smaller less expensive but more charming place and saved our money. Neighborhood is also totally devoid of charm. Just a bunch of archaic overpriced stores (Bottega, Gucci etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to shop Montaigne”
Reviews.Author: HopingThisHelps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in June. Cannot find any fault with the service, the rooms are fine, and location is perfect if you plan to do a lot of shopping- Chanel, Bottega, and Celine are just across the street. Only drawback is the hotel lobby area and coffee shop is kind of a scene, which is probably why I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the very place to see and be seen”
Reviews.Author: eleonoraVienna
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel in the right location, with the right atmosphere. Junior art deco suites are small, narrow, french 18th Century's are a bit more spacious. Room staff are very nice, staff downstairs spoiled thus rather nosy. Good pastries, correct breakfast, good bistro Le Relais. Restaurant always full could never get a table on a last-moment reservation: a bottle of champagne is no con-soluation!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MomoDubai
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short trip to Paris and a few wonderful days at the Plaza Athenee. The service is impecable and the view of the Eifel tower from your room amazing. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Truly one of the finest hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: mirafloresMiami
Reviews.Content: Quite simply everything about this hotel was perfect. From the superb staff to the exquisite linens, every detail was beautifully thought out and executed.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: jrp9f
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza Athenee with three girlfriends (in two rooms) for a long weekend in April and can't say I'd likely stay here again. The service was impeccable and the hotel is beautiful but my big problem was that the walls were so super thin that you couldn't get a good night's sleep (and I'm a very heavy sleeper!). You could hear even hear our neighbor snoring through the walls! And one morning I was woken up by our neighbor opening and closing drawers which was too bad as the bed was really very comfortable. And personally, I'm not a big fan of the location - every time we did something, we took a taxi (but there is a taxi stand across the street so it was very easy to catch one) as there weren't really any restaurants or bars nearby. But if high end shopping is what you are looking for, this is your place! It's surrounded by Louis, Chanel, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a great location overlooking the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: DunedinEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a fantastic time. The hotel provided unrivalled, but discreet, service. You have to go to the bar - the peanuts are excellent! But watch the prices...

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: coffeebar
Reviews.Content: In the finale episodes of "sex and the city", Carry Bradshaw went after her Russian lover to Paris, and stayed with him at the Plaza Athenee. She soon realized that like her lover, the hotel though beautiful, is heartless and made her miss the pulse and the warmth of her girlfriends and of New York City. Well, I love Paris more then I love NYC and my experience at the Plaza Athenee was exactly the same. The Plaza Athenee hotel is not what it seems nor what it strives you to believe it is in their website and buzz. Sure, it is very attractive and located in the fabulous Avenue Montaigne which is home to all the high end shops. Chanel. Dior, Lagerfeld, Gucci, Ysl and what name you â€“ they are all here, along with all the very very rich women, shopping mechanically, putting on a bored face while spending 2000 EUR on a shirt. While I have no problem with bored rich women (sometimes I wish I was one!) nor with high fashion which I actually love, I do have a problem with a hotel that promises to be "the pulse" of the fashion industry, "the place to see and to be seen", and in reality is stiff, BORING and far, far away from "happening". . PA has the same face like those women I was talking about: it is pretty, immaculately kept, but. What you are left with, is frustration and no joy of life. So if you are looking for this kind of atmosphere: an elegant, expensive stiff palace â€“ you are much better off at the Ritz, which is by far more luxurious, historical and authentic then the Plaza Athenee, And if you are looking for the fashionable and glamorous Paris, go to Hotel Costes. in my point of view, Hotels that charge 600+ EUR a night for their least expensive room are not selling accommodation. They are selling an experience and in my opinion, Plaza Athenee does not deliver anything but nice accommodation and location. it is not the real thing and not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “For the love of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: chiqa
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews for the hotels I stay in, but I felt that after reading some of the previous negative comments on here(which almost discouraged me from staying at the hotel) and having loved my stay at the Plaza Athenee, that I had to write something! My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over the New Year period and we both loved it! From the moment we arrived at the hotel to our departure, the service was impeccable! I have stayed in many hotels around the world and on occasions I know that sometimes hotel staff can be a bit too attentive and overbearing, or the complete opposite, but the staff at Plaza Athenee had it on point. We stayed in a junior suite which was on the 7th floor and it was the art-deco style, which may not be to some people's taste..but we found that the layout and decor of the room was lovely..the bathroom (which I personally think is one of the best things to judge a hotel on) was clean, beautiful and well equipped..but the best part of the room was the view!! We did request a view of Avenue Montaigne, and this was granted! We had two little balconies which gave us a stunning view of Avenue Montaigne and the eiffel tower! I would say it was a similar view to the one shown in SATC..it was simply breathtaking!! The atmosphere in the hotel was warm and friendly and during the festive period, the lobby was so so beautiful, with a huge Christmas tree and gorgeous decorations..I found the staff at the reception and concierge to be very accommodating and friendly..however if I were to be pedantic, a member of staff at the 'cashier's desk' was slightly moody looking..but that is a minor point. The food we ordered through room service was delicious, a very good choice of dishes and of a good standard, and generous portions. The breakfast service was excellent too, a good selection and the fruit was so fresh.. Also, the minibar in the room was well stocked, the best stocked minibar I have seen so far. We found that the location of the hotel was perfect for shopping and within walking distance of many places, and there were plenty of taxis on hand if needed, which were well arranged by the doormen. Overall, we found this hotel to be very very good..I think what makes it so appealing, are the little things they add which give it that 'personal touch' and it seems that they try to fulfil any requests which are made, which is good..We would definitely stay there again! Just to add..the prices are high, but realistically, that is to be expected for this type of hotel. Just to give a rough idea, a main dish for lunch/dinner from the room service menu averages at about 40 euros, the cheapest being a plate of pasta at around 24 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ajsue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days at this great hotel at the end of October. Everything from check-in to concierge to room service to the condition of the room to the quality of the food (mostly breakfasts through room service) was outstanding. We were expecting some push-back from the staff based on some reviews I read, but my wife and I found everyone to be extraordinary friendly and helpful in answering any questions. Everyone we encountered spoke English so that was not an issue since our knowledge of French is limited to less than five words. Our room was beautiful, quiet, and well-appointed. We did not even have to ask for a better room on check-in. They had room available, and offered an upgrade before I could ask. Perfect location too. Definitely rivals some of the best hotels in the US which we have stayed in such as Ritz Carlton and St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “ja'dore Plaza Athenee”
Reviews.Author: OnthegogirlChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly an experience. It is located between the Avenue des Champs ElysÃ©es and the Eiffel Tower on The Avenue Montaigne which is truly one of the best streets for shopping in Paris. The hotel is truly a scene, with Le Bar that serves creative cocktails and a gallery for tea where true Parisian style is on display. The hotel restaurant Alain Ducasse is a truly magnificent mix of French style with a contemporary flair. I was fortunate enough to stay in a room that faced The Avenue Montaigne and had an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. I have also stayed in the superior suite, which faced the courtyard, but I have to say I would go for a smaller room with a view then a suite that faced the courtyard. This is truly a hotel that should be seen when in Paris, even if it is only for a drink or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - arrogant tired reception”
Reviews.Author: CleoStockholm
