Reviews.Content: Plaza AthenÃ©e is one of the palace hotels in Paris (it is not allowed in France to give any hotel 5 stars & instead the lux hotels use the term "palace") and in this cathegory they are a disappointment. The hotel itself is beautiful & on the Madison of Paris if you like - just make sure to have a classical room. The problem with the hotel lies in the service level and management. Arrogant reception and just look at the chaos outside of the hotel - they are understaffed meaning that you rarely get prompt help parking your car or getting a taxi, this is a no no for a lux hotel. Just reading through reviews on here you will notice that a lot of people have to change rooms, they will without problem put you in a low ceiling 7th floor art deco nightmare. Instead of actually lowering the rates for these lesser rooms - they seem to have a policy of taking a chance you won't complain and if you will they will move you the next day (always the next day) and will have managed to reach the higher room rate for that night. Clever? Well in the end no, as not all people are that stupid. We all compare to what we are used to and if getting greeted by security staff and bar/lounge staff constantly impresses you this is sufficient - if you are experienced and looking for a true 5 star hotel; go to Ritz, Bristol, Crillion or George V instead. The bar is considered Paris hottest (although this is mainly true during fashion weeks) and Alain Ducasse extremely boring. Try any other 3 or 2 star restaurant as Alain is considered quite classical (=boring) compared to other more famed french chefs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Meist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza Athenee with my boyfriend for 3 nights at the beginning of April. The hotel is in a great location, between the Champs-Elysees and the Eifffel Tower. All the staff are very friendly and the decor is luxurious. We were given a deluxe art-deco room on the 7th floor but because I am a HUGE SATC fan we asked to move to a classical room. I've never asked to move in a hotel before but they couldn't have been nicer about it. They couldn't move us on the first night (a weeknight) as they were full but the next day transferred all our luggage and the new room looked out over the front of the hotel. We had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. Some people in the hotel are very posh and I would recommend taking smarter clothes, especially if staying during the week. Over the weekend things were more relaxed but in the week we were the only people in the breakfast room not wearing suits! Overall a wonderful stay. The hotel really is first class and in my opinion better than many of the 5-star hotels in other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: fifaie
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday present from my husband I am a huge sex and the city fan and could not wait to stay here. Its true its not cheep but if you like celeb spotting and dressing up and feeling generally fabulous! this is most definatley the place for you. We were lucky to be staying in the hotel at the end of fashion week this year so there was a lot of buzz in the hotel constantly. The rooms and decor of the hotel is beautiful. We had great fun sitting in the bar at night drinking a bottle of champagne - which is cheeper then the wine! and people watching. My advise dont go to this hotel if you dont want to mix with the rich and famous and spend some money - I asure you it is neither the time nor the place !

Reviews.Title: “OK, But not "all that"”
Reviews.Author: CAtravel39
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was so excited about this hotel, but didn't love it as much as I thought that I would. My husband was in Paris for work and I decided to fly out and join him. We had a wonderful one bedroom suite with an amazing view and the hotel is on a beautiful street, but that was about all I really loved. I wish I would have been a little closer to things. The "crowd" was much different than my husband and I. Older and colder I would say. We are young and successful and like staying in really nice hotels, but we were among the rich and stuffy of the world. My husband whose stayed all over Paris (including the Crillion several times) says the Anthenee has WAY better rooms, but the Crillion has a better vibe. I never thought that I would say this about any hotel because I think that vacations warrant spending money and the best is always worth the price, but in the case of this hotel the price wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “They deliver on the promise”
Reviews.Author: mstolper
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and quiet room, room service in 15 minutes repeatedly, helpful concierges, great location, nice attended gym, and great food. The bistro (not the three star restaurant) is as good as anything you'll find in NewYork or San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: pippy204
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my 3 night stay at the Plaza Athenee in Paris. My Partner suprised me with a 3 night break to Paris for my 30th Birthday. After arriving on the Eurostar our driver met us at the station and drove us to the hotel (which the hotel had arranged). Our room was not ready when we arrived so we relaxed in the lounge drinking coffee. My first thoughts were what a beautiful hotel and how nice the staff were. 20 mins later we were taken up to our room which over looked the main courtyard, again very pretty. The room was amazing very comfortable and spacious. We returned from lunch to find champagne on ice as the hotel new it was my birthday, with a card. Very nice touch. On the day of my birthday (the sunday) the hotel left a Plaza Athenee box containing a chocolate tile with a crab on it (sign of July/Cancer) again very nice touch. The hotel must of known the atual date of my birthday from my passport they copied on arrival. Over all i would recomend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay there, great for special occasions. The staff are so attentive and very friendly. The only people who are pretentious are the people who drop in for coffee or lunch who are not atually staying at the hotel. I had the best time here!

Reviews.Title: “Great service but rooms only a little better than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjorkebo73
Reviews.Content: I went to Plaza Athenee for a weekend splurge. Before arriving the concierge helped me book a table at Guy Savoy, their own restaurant Alain Ducasse, Benoit and Chez Eux. That saved me a lot of time! By the way all restaurants were excellent although Paris is getting very expensive... Benoit which has one star was really nice, relaxed in a very upscale traditional bistrot environment. But back to Plaza Athenee, the reception was nice, many of the staff learned my name. Bar is sensationally good, very beautiful people hang there you just have to live with a price for a drink of 25 Euro.. Bar has a cool design. In the courtyard they have a ice track so you can borrow skates and swirl around. Breakfast is 63 EURO so i decided to have a coffe and croissant at La Duree instead for a tenth of the price... The room was nice although the bathroom felt very small and the shower sprinkled water all of the bathroom when showering. I also think that a 5 star hotel should have seperate shower and bathtub which was not the case here. Toilet was small and the bathroom door blocked the toilet if open. Furniture in room was 4+ stars not 5. Bed was comfortable. I like when a hotel has a small cd collection to be able to play music in room but i did not find such collection without having to pay. So only a radio without pre set stations and finding a good one was difficult with 100 of stations. So please pre-set nice stations with news, classical music, jazz, pop, rock, hip hop, country and so forth. Location was great for shopping all the designer boutiques are on the same street as the hotel so you can just go back to the hotel with bags and continue shopping...:) So my overall impression is good service, location, rooms not up to a 5 star standard, little bit too expensive so value is below average. Normal rate was 540 i payed 300 due to corporate rate which made the deal better. But paying normal rate then i would be very, very little value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Go to The Crillon!”
Reviews.Author: Gingersheep
Reviews.Content: Arrived here looking forward to a lovely weekend break with my husband and left hugely disappointed. Having stayed in The Crillion last year perhaps my expectations were too high. The service in the hotel was excellent but the standard of accommodation is no better than a Hilton or Holiday Inn but double or even triple the price. Our first room had an adjoining door (we requested and were given a move) and little in the way of soundproofing, which meant we could hear everything in the neighbouring room, indeed the soundproofing in the second room wasn't particularly good either. If you are looking for a luxury hotel please take it from me go to The Crillon.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy stay at the Plaza Athenee”
Reviews.Author: bakersl
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel for spring break with my mom. The weather wasn't very good but the hotel was a safe haven from the stormy and cold weather outside. We had a deluxe room(you can see from the pictures I posted above) and it was more than enough space. I did have the chance to glance at a suite while housekeeping was fixing it up and I was very impressed. We ate twice in the room for dinner. The first time was ok. The hamburger wasn't anything special for the price but the prize winning rasberry and chocolate dessert was very good. The second time was much better. Breakfast room service was steep and the continental's pastries were ok. I would recommend going down to the restaurant for breakfast. If you dont want to eat there for dinner you get a chance to see it for breakfast and get anything you want. We got a huge basket of pastries and fresh squeezed juice drinks. The dinning room is also beautiful. The one problem for us was that my mom and I like to walk around hotels even if we arent staying at them just to see for another trip. This hotel is very locked off to lookers and I saw some people coming in just to look around and everything is mostly behind glass doors and there are lots of people with walkey-talkeys walking around. Other than that it was excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Plaza Athenee
HotelInfo.Address: 25 avenue Montaigne, 75008 Paris, France
